newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodian PM reaffirms support for Beijing.
newsitem.headline: Cambodian PM reaffirms support for Beijing.

text.p: Cambodia's co-Premier Hun Sen reaffirmed the country's support for China on Friday saying political delegations from Taiwan would not be welcome in his country.
"The government follows a one-China policy and we can't accept a political-level delegation but we welcome an investment delegation," he told reporters.
China has regarded Taiwan as a renegade province since a civil war split them in 1949 and refuses to recognise any country that has official ties with the island.
Taiwan, which has a trade office in Phnom Penh, is the leading foreign investor in Cambodia followed by China, officials of the state-run Cambodian Development Corporation said.
